sortingnetworksparallel

Class Processor

  • java.lang.Object
    • sortingnetworksparallel.Processor

  • public class Processor
extends java.lang.Object
    Processes the given amount of channels and the maximum amount of comparators (upperbound) and returns a sorting network of optimal size when the upperbound is high enough.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Processor(short nbChannels, int upperBound, int innerSize, double percThreads)
      Create a Processor which can, for a given nbChannels and upperBound find a minimal sorting network if there is one with less than or equal to upperBound.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Processor

        public Processor(short nbChannels,
                 int upperBound,
                 int innerSize,
                 double percThreads)
        Create a Processor which can, for a given nbChannels and upperBound find a minimal sorting network if there is one with less than or equal to upperBound.
        Parameters:
        nbChannels - The amount of channels for the networks.
        upperBound - The maximum amount of comparators to use.
        innerSize - The amount of the inner size of the lists for each thread.
        percThreads - The percentage of usage of the threads.

    • Method Detail

      • process

        public short[] process()
        For a given nbChannels and upperBound find a minimal sorting network if there is one with less than or equal to upperBound.
        Returns:
        The found optimal size sorting network.

      • processData

        public void processData(short[][] data,
                        short newComp,
                        int startIndex)
        Processes the data for the new comparator. Adding the comparator to the data[0] is assumed to be done already.
        Parameters:
        data - The network
        newComp - The comparator to process the data on.
        startIndex - The outerIndex of where to start. (= 1 will cover everything.)

      • generate

        public it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.objects.ObjectArrayList<short[][]> generate(NullArray networkList,
                                                                         int startIndex,
                                                                         int length,
                                                                         short nbComp)
        Generate networks by expanding the given networks with all possible comparators. (Redundant comparators are neglected, see isRedundantComp) This assumes networkLists back-array contains no nulls upto size().
        Parameters:
        networkList - The list that contains the networks to expand.
        startIndex - The index of the first network in the list to expand.
        length - The amount of networks to expand. (startIndex to startIndex+length-1)
        nbComp - The outerIndex of the comparator (data[0][nbComp]) to start working on.
        Returns:
        A list of generated networks, expanded by all possible comparators to the given network.
        See Also:
        getChangeIndex(short[][], short)

      • innerPrune

        public void innerPrune(it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.objects.AbstractObjectList<short[][]> networkList)
        Prune N by removing every network that is being subsumed by another network. This operation is not concurrent. N should not be modified/read while this operation is ongoing.
        Parameters:
        networkList - The list of networks to prune in.

      • prune

        public void prune(NullArray networkList,
                  int networkIndex,
                  int skipSize)
        Prune in the given list of networks by using subsumes with the given network located on networkList.get(networkIndex). When the same network is found in the network list it will be ignored. When the network is to be removed by the subsumes rule it will remove it from the networkList and stop execution even before the whole list is iterated over.
        Parameters:
        networkList - The list of networks to prune on.
        networkIndex - The outerIndex of the network located in the networkList used to perform subsumes with (in 2 directions).
        skipSize - The networks with outerIndex >= networkIndex and < skipSize+networkIndex aren't checked.

      • existsAValidPerm

        public boolean existsAValidPerm(short[][] network1,
                                short[][] network2)
        Check if a valid permutation exists. It creates a potential list of permutations that might work by using the network information (P and L) and iterates trying these permutations to find a correct one.
        Parameters:
        network1 - The first network as part of network1 subsumes? network2
        network2 - The second network as part of network1 subsumes? network2
        Returns:
        Whether there exists a valid permutation by which p(outputs(network1)) C= outputs(network2)

      • testPossiblePermutations

        public boolean testPossiblePermutations(short[][] network1,
                                        short[][] network2,
                                        byte[][] Ps)
        Iterative method to check all permutations of the permutation table Ps.
        Parameters:
        network1 - The first network as part of network1 subsumes? network2
        network2 - The second network as part of network1 subsumes? network2
        Ps - The permutation table
        Returns:
        Whether or not there exists a permutation such that network1 subsumes network2.

      • checkAllRelevantPermutations

        public boolean checkAllRelevantPermutations(short[][] network1,
                                            short[][] network2,
                                            byte[][] Ps,
                                            int currIndex,
                                            byte[] soFar,
                                            int posTaken)
        Recursive method to check all permutations of the permutation table Ps.
        Parameters:
        network1 - The first network as part of network1 subsumes? network2
        network2 - The second network as part of network1 subsumes? network2
        Ps - The permutation table
        currIndex - Used by the recursive algorithm, when calling this method you should use 0
        soFar - The permutation so far, when calling this method you should use new byte[nbChannels]
        posTaken - The positions already taken, when calling this method you should use 0
        Returns:
        Whether or not there exists a permutation such that network1 subsumes network2

      • getOriginalInputs

        public short[][] getOriginalInputs()
        Get all original inputs excluding the already sorted ones.
        Returns:
        range from 2 to (2^nbChannels-1) excluding all sorted (binary) ones.

      • factorial

        public static long factorial(int n)
        Calculates the factorial of a given number.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of which the factorial has to be calculated
        Returns:
        n!

      • getPermutations

        public static short[] getPermutations(short start,
                                      short maxBits)
        Get all permutations possible using the start and the max amount of bits.
        Parameters:
        start - The start value. Normally a value with all 1's on the right side.
        maxBits - The maximum amount of bits available. (nbChannels)
        Returns:
        All permutations starting with start that are smaller than (2^maxBits)-1

      • checkPermutationPartOf

        public boolean checkPermutationPartOf(short[][] network1,
                                      short[][] network2)
        Reduce work: Lemma 6: C1 subsumes C2 => P(w(C1, x, k)) C= w(C2, x, k)
        Parameters:
        network1 - C1
        network2 - C2
        Returns:
        Whether or not network1 is maybe part of network2 according to lemma 6

      • processW

        public void processW(short[][] data,
                     short comp,
                     int startIndex)
        Change the w(data, x, k) according to the new comparator and the already existing data.
        Parameters:
        data - The network to update
        comp - The comparator which was added
        startIndex - The index where the first change should be made
